MAR-MAR] An inherently defensive tactic used to force a vessel to alter course away from the defended asset or stop its closure. It is accomplished by maneuvering a unit directly in front of the closing vessel and maintaining position. The possibility of collision exists, depending on the intent of the closing vessel.

* A fire control order used to direct air defense units to stop tactical action against a specified target. Missiles in flight will continue to intercept.
Stop firing, do not open fire. Missiles in flight will continue to intercept; continue to track.
